title: What is the role of Customer Service?
text1: The Customer Service department is responsible for managing customer relationship channels, including electronic and phone support.
text2: More than an operational sector, Customer Service is a strategic area, essential for maintaining the values, reputation and credibility of the Group's brands.
card_text: Humanized, efficient and high-quality service not only resolves demands: it builds trust, strengthens bonds and directly contributes to customer loyalty.
text3: Besides external customers, Customer Service also plays a fundamental role in supporting company employees, clarifying questions about processes, systems and service standards. This contributes to the standardization, organization and excellence of the service provided.

box_attention.title: Curiosity
box_attention.text: Customer experience studies indicate that a single negative interaction can impact brand perception more than several positive interactions. That's why every contact counts.

text4: Customer Service goes far beyond answering calls. It represents the company's voice in direct contact with the customer. Each interaction influences how the consumer perceives the brand and evaluates their experience.

quiz.question: A frustrated customer contacts you because their problem still hasn't been resolved. How should a strategically-minded CS agent handle this situation?
quiz.opt_a: A) As an annoyance that should be ended as quickly as possible.
quiz.opt_b: B) As an opportunity to reverse a negative experience and strengthen trust in the brand.
quiz.opt_c: C) As a failure from another department that's not your responsibility.
quiz.opt_d: D) Just follow the standard script without showing empathy.
quiz.feedback: Correct Answer! Strategic vision transforms crises into loyalty opportunities.
